alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 8:55PM PST until December 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...South to southwest winds 25 to 45 mph with damaging gusts between 60 and 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Mountains. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down large objects such as trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Roadways that may be affected include Highways 154...as well as the Gaviota and San Marcos Passes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
